intro: Pholidota protracta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pholidota, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many plants with unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Pholidota protracta is often used in traditional medicine due to its potential pharmacological properties.
